name: Fivermusic
overview:
Fivermusic is a record label / digital music distribution service who sells your music on iTunes and other places, for a one-off fee. We then pay you 100% of the money your music makes in royalties every six months.

Since 2010 we’ve been running the progressive house record label Gold Shore Records. Within this time we’ve received hundreds if not thousands of demos from talented artists around the world that didn’t fit our genre or weren’t up to the very high standard of mastering our genre requires. In 2011 I received an excellent trance demo, which was shared with us and 72 other labels on Soundcloud, trance not being our genre I left it for the other guys and tried to buy it a few weeks later on iTunes. Turns out this track never got signed, and still hasn’t been.

This didn’t make much sense to me, and when we started asking around we found out that hundreds of these demos weren’t making it onto labels because they didn’t fit the genre or weren’t produced by David Guetta. Now, we know from running a label that times are tough in the music world but it seems silly to not have a platform to sell your music just because there’s not a label to take you on.

This is even worse for bands and non-dance music musicians, the major labels have the commercial sound so nailed down you either have to be ground breaking or hooked up to get a contract, and even they don’t always sell well. If a label does accept you, you’re going to take a hefty hit on the royalties to be part of them, as we well know. You can release through an open source distributor but the monthly subscriptions or one off release costs are through the roof! So we asked ourselves, what does the band or producer do who has fans, friends and family who want to buy their music?

Other than hosting their music on Soundcloud, not much was the answer. So we created Fivermusic, an easy and fair way to turn your musical masterpieces from an audio file into cash. We don’t charge you $70 a month to host your songs on dodgydownload.com, we send your music out to the biggest download stores around the world, including iTunes, Amazon and Google. We make sure that every track is embellished with your personal metadata so your fans and more can find you in an instant, complete with your album art, artist and song names and genre. Then when the royalties come rolling in, we don’t take 50% and bath in cash, we give you every last penny that the distributors send our way.
